meanings.definition: To supervise or monitor a test or examination.
meanings.sent1: During the exam, the teacher invigilated the students to prevent cheating.
meanings.sent2: The proctor invigilated the test to ensure fairness.
meanings.sent3: The vigilant teacher invigilated the exam with eagle eyes.
meanings.sent4: She invigilated the room like a hawk, catching any signs of dishonesty.
meanings.sent5: The strict invigilation made sure no one broke the rules during the test.

meanings.definition: To watch over or oversee a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The lifeguard invigilated the swimmers to ensure their safety.
meanings.sent2: The security guard invigilated the crowd during the event.
meanings.sent3: The babysitter invigilated the children playing in the park.
meanings.sent4: The supervisor invigilated the employees to maintain productivity.
meanings.sent5: The parent invigilated the kids at the playground, keeping a close eye on them.
